definition: to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker

sentences.chinese: 猶如那搖曳的風中之燭。

sentences.english: He was like a reed moving in wind.
sentences.chinese: 希律王就像一根隨風搖曳的蘆葦。

sentences.english: The breeze set the flames of the street lamps quavering.
Wild mustards flicker on the field.
On Hubin Road, I walked alongside West Lake beneath swaying willow trees.
sentences.chinese: 在湖濱路，我沿着西湖穿行在搖曳的垂柳下。

sentences.english: As I opened the window, the flame wavered and then went out .
sentences.chinese: 當我打開窗戶，這火焰搖曳，接着就熄滅了。

sentences.english: Golden rape flower in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 金黃的油菜花在風中搖曳。

sentences.english: What constantly recurs to me is "The rain patters, the leaf quivers."[1]
sentences.chinese: 我時常能記起的是“天上淅瀝下雨，樹葉婆娑搖曳”。

sentences.english: The bough swayed ih the rainstorm, not in the breeze, until go to death…
sentences.chinese: 我渴望所有的枯枝敗葉都在暴風雨中搖曳，直至消亡。

sentences.english: There were many red beautiful azalea , waving in the wind .
sentences.chinese: 壩旁邊的山上有美麗嫣紅的映山紅在風中搖曳。
在白雪飄飛的季節裏搖曳。

sentences.english: The remaining of thousand years flutters those blooming flower seasons, floating to fall those raining seasons.
sentences.chinese: 千年的餘輝搖曳那些花季，飄落那些雨季。

sentences.english: even though it is the holiday season. Just seeing little twinkling lights around
sentences.chinese: 即使是聖誕季。僅僅看着四周搖曳的微光，

sentences.english: It is the tear of the earth that keep her smile in bloom.
sentences.chinese: 大地之上還搖曳着的清淚，更顯出它現在的笑靨如花。

sentences.english: At this moment, only endless thoughts in that dry die in a prison of the branches swaying.
sentences.chinese: 此時此刻，惟有無盡的思念在那枯瘐的枝頭搖曳。

sentences.english: Emerald-green wheat grew in the fields by the side of the road, swaying evenly in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 路邊的田裏長着碧綠的青麥子，整齊地隨風搖曳。

definition: fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
